summary: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, Congress made up to $454 billion available for Federal Reserve lending programs. The Fed worked with Treasury to establish 9 programs that are supported by CARES Act funds. The programs, however, haven't been used much—they're at about 1% of lending capacity. While the programs likely improved some corporate and municipal credit markets, state and local governments and small businesses...
title: Federal Reserve Lending Programs: Use of CARES Act-Supported Programs Has Been Limited and Flow of Credit Has Generally Improved
